verses.verse: For you are our glory and joy.
(Concern for Their Faith) Therefore, when we could no longer endure it, we thought it good to be left in Athens alone,
and sent (Rom. 16:21) Timothy, our brother and minister of God, and our fellow laborer in the gospel of Christ, to establish you and encourage you concerning your faith,
(Eph. 3:13) that no one should be shaken by these afflictions; for you yourselves know that (John 16:2; Acts 9:16; 14:22; 1 Cor. 4:9; 2 Tim. 3:12; 1 Pet. 2:21) we are appointed to this.
(Acts 20:24) For, in fact, we told you before when we were with you that we would suffer tribulation, just as it happened, and you know.
For this reason, when I could no longer endure it, I sent to know your faith, (1 Cor. 7:5) lest by some means the tempter had tempted you, and (Gal. 2:2) our labor might be in vain.

(Encouraged by Timothy) (Acts 18:5) But now that Timothy has come to us from you, and brought us good news of your faith and love, and that you always have good remembrance of us, greatly desiring to see us, (Phil. 1:8) as we also to see youâ€”
therefore, brethren, in all our affliction and distress (2 Cor. 1:4) we were comforted concerning you by your faith.
For now we live, if you ((Eph. 6:13, 14); Phil. 4:1) stand fast in the Lord.
For what thanks can we render to God for you, for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sake before our God,
night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face (2 Cor. 13:9; Col. 4:12) and perfect what is lacking in your faith?
(Prayer for the Church) Now may our God and Father Himself, and our Lord Jesus Christ, (Mark 1:3) direct our way to you.
And may the Lord make you increase and (Phil. 1:9; 1 Thess. 4:1, 10; 2 Thess. 1:3) abound in love to one another and to all, just as we do to you,
so that He may establish (2 Thess. 2:17) your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all His saints.

(Plea for Purity) Finally then, brethren, we urge and exhort in the Lord Jesus (1 Cor. 15:58) that you should abound more and more, (Phil. 1:27; Col. 1:10) just as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God;
for you know what commandments we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
For this is ((Rom. 12:2)) the will of God, (Eph. 5:27) your sanctification: ((1 Cor. 6:15-20; Col. 3:5)) that you should abstain from sexual immorality;
(Rom. 6:19) that each of you should know how to possess his own vessel in sanctification and honor,
